However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms

When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. Ahe survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth.

However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole jo

This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's ga

When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their att

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because

When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a

When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the hum

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much strong

The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strengh

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully t

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themse

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to th

This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Ear

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that

However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back d

Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly,

As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down i

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their lo

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallu

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio sign

Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to

For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinat

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities.

When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely s

As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result,

When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spe

Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth eve

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything product

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything producti

Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything productive with their tim

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything productive with their time

This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything productive with their time as there are no th

And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything productive with their time as there are no threats remaining

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again. Unfortunately, however, this power is not enough to defeat the invaders. The old power that reawakens does so in little spurts and it is hardly enough to overcome the hostile aliens. However, these spurts are enough to cause all sorts of things to change-including the abilities of those who possess it. This means that the people who have Mana suddenly feel an onset of odd physical and mental symptoms, including loss of memory, hallucinations, and strange abilities. 

In their weakened state, people who have Mana are of no use against the hostile aliens. As a result, the survivors who possess Mana are sent out into space to be what they call "Watchers" of the Earth. Their sole job is to radio back to Earth when they sense a threat to the people on Earth, regardless of whether that threat is coming from within the Earth's galaxy or outside of it. Meanwhile, all the other humans are left on Earth to try to fend for themselves. Their attempts are at first futile, because their counterattacks are so few and so disorganized, but the humans soon discover that they possess other strengths. For example, the women are now able to give birth to girls twice as frequently as before, and the men are able to produce much more sperm. This produces a population boom. As a result, the human race becomes much stronger as there is strength in numbers. The aliens then launch a last-ditch attempt to destroy the humans on Earth, but this too ends fail as the humans fight back with considerable strength. Once humans have successfully defended themselves on Earth, they send a radio signal up to the Watchers of the Earth to let them know that they can come back down. Interestingly, the Watchers of the Earth do not come down immediately and that is because of their loss of memory and hallucinations. Upon receiving the radio signal directing them to return to Earth, the Watchers promptly forget it. And later, when the radio signal comes through with the same instruction again, the Watchers of the Earth end up hallucinating that the radio signal was falsely sent. So as a result, the Watchers spend an additional year watching over the Earth even though they are not actually doing anything productive with their time as there are no threats remaining t
